description: tan color vertical sculpture shaped like three stacked boxes of different sizes; between and connecting boxes are many cylindrical vertical thin tube shapes
signed: stamped at lower side corner, near base: 光 {Hikaru}
text: Yamada Hikaru was a founding member of the influential artist group Sōdeisha, literally the Crawling through Mud Association, that was instrumental for the birth of an avant-garde in Japanese ceramics. Originally trained in making utilitarian vessels, its members experimented with new forms and began creating unusual and individual sculptures.
title: Boxes and Pipes
